ygData.msgSnippet: The tables had now turned.  Tucson Prime had Rodimus back on his side and like Rodimus, he wasn t about to take anything lying down. He soon catches up to

The tables had now turned.  Tucson Prime had Rodimus back on his side and l=
ike Rodimus, he wasn't about to take anything lying down. He soon catches u=
p to Night Shift and finds him without Kup. 

"Where's Kup? I asked him to =
back you up in finding Windlord."

Night Shift shruggs.

" Well, ya know ho=
w he's buddy, buddy with Rodimus... He went ta help 'em find Nightlight. It=
's cool, it's cool, I can handle it, sometimes things don't change.  But sl=
ag, he could've at least asked me first!"

Tucson Prime narrows a brow.

" =
Hmm... Yeah, that would've been nice.  All right, looks like Windlord's up =
to us now.  But just to be on the safe side...  Kup this is Tucson Prime, e=
xplain your abrupt deviation from my orders, over!"

He was losing his temp=
er.  He didn't like deviations from his orders even if they were for the ri=
ght reasons.  It was what separated him from Rodimus, and like Optimus Prim=
e, he was most tolerant of things but not when it came to being critcle of =
orders which could upset the delicate balance of the mission at hand.

Nigh=
tshift gets a fix on Windlord's signature and follows it quietly.  Tucson P=
rime backs him up with a sword in hand.  He was prepared to use it if he ha=
d to.  

" I dunno about you big bot but I got a feel'n that with Rodimus b=
ack in the picture it might be kinda confusn' as ta which one of you guys s=
hould we all obey. Rodimus sounds legit, but me trust that overgrown hot ro=
d?  I don't think so."

Tucson replies, as he waits for Kups' answer.

" I'=
m fully prepared for what arguements lie ahead Nightshift.  Yes, there will=
 be tension among us.  And that's why I'd like to meet with everyone at the=
 Ark, including Lord Perseus's group of Maximals.  I don't want us to fight=
 like Predacons and Decepticons.  That's not of our nature.  But we do have=
 issues and they need to be addressed.  I figured this way we could all exp=
ress what's on our minds without physical harm to anyone."

Night Shift sig=
hs while following the energy signature.

" You sound more'n more like Opti=
mus, ya know that?  He'd be the same way.  And there ain't nothn' wrong wit=
h it.  With you around it's like havn' the big guy with us."

It was true. =
 Tucson Prime was indeed Optimus Prime's decendent.  Even his manerisms mat=
ch those of the legendary Autobot leader.  He hoped that he could lead his =
group as Optimus did.  With compassion, understanding and most of all hones=
ty.

" Let's hope I can keep things peaceful among everyone once we get bac=
k to the Ark."

Outside, Rat Trap gets Rodimus's transmission, and seethes =
with frustration.  He, most of all was not thrilled with Rodimus for litera=
lly dropping the ball on everyone.  Quick Stride also gets the message, and=
 scratches behind his left ear.

" Well, at least he appologized for his ac=
tions Rat Trap, ya gotta give 'em that."

Rat Trap glares at his large comr=
ade.

" Words, words, words.  That's all they are Quickstride, words.  Unle=
ss I see it for myself I ain't trustn' no hot rod with a fancy flame job on=
 his hood!  As far as I'm concerned, Lord Elder, and Wheels are the only tw=
o guys I'll take orders from.  Think about it, if Lizard lips can con Rodim=
us inta workn' for e'm the first time, he can do it again.  Know why?  Beca=
use Rodimus is a sucker for punnishment.  He got 'emself inta that mess in =
the first place.  Now, look at Wheels, yeah, he got captured but he didn't =
let anyone get inta his mainframe did he?  No, he stood up ta punnishment a=
nd he stood up ta Lizard Lips no matter how much it hurt 'em.  Thats a lead=
er I follow."

Quickstride thinks for a moment.

"Hmm, you're right about t=
hat.  Tucson Prime's been through Hell'n back and he's never once let that =
overgrown iguanna take over his directory. "

Rat Trap nodds in agreement.
=

"See?  Even you get it.  But now that Rodimus is back, he's gonna wanna ta=
ke full leadership back.  I know that ain't gonna be easy on Wheels.  I'm s=
urprised he ain't blown his stack on Rodimus yet. Oops, that reminds me, Lo=
rd Elder's expectn' a report from me.  I almost forgot!   Lord Elder, Rat T=
rap here, and I got great news.  Wheels did it sir. He was able ta jump sta=
rt Rodimus and Rodimus is back on our side... Ughhh, ummm, un - fortunately=
..  But, at least he's on our side again..  Anyway, they're still tryn' ta =
get Nightlight'n Windlord outa there, and as far as I know, Rodimus sprung =
everyone. Well, that wouldn'tve been possible if Wheels hadn't gotten throu=
gh ta him.  Anyway, that's the report, over."

Inside the fortress, even Ni=
ghtshift was having a hard time digesting the fact that Rodimus was back in=
 the picture.  It was visible in his mannerisms, and Tucson Prime had a lon=
g haul ahead of him, trying to keep the peace among the Autobots and Maxima=
ls.  Yet, he too ponders Rodimus's transmission which took him a long time =
to reply to, but as Optimus Prime would have replied, he does the same.

" =
This is Tucson Prime, I copy you Rodimus Prime.  Although your words are en=
couraging, I must say I meet them with a bit of apprehension myself.   I wi=
ll do everything in my power to keep the peace among us, but do keep in min=
d, trust will be the most difficult thing to gain among our faction.  You h=
ave turned against us in the past, served our enemy faithfully, and for tha=
t, many of us are leary of your return to our side.  You show a vulnerabili=
ty to be easilly swayed and in order to regain your status among us, you mu=
st prove you can overcome this vulnerability.  So it is with this in mind, =
that I request you pass a test of loyalty toward our faction.  A test that =
only I  can adiminister, and a test only I can deem you worthy of passing. =
 And until such time that I have deemed you worthy of this task, leadership=
 of the Autobots will be diverted to me, and none of my orders are to be di=
sobeyed.  Do I have your word and compliance Rodimus Prime?"
